title: Strange 'copy package' behavior
description: When performing the 'copy package' action in the org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui package of the jdt.ui plugin, the package 'ui' is copied to the destination folder, but it should not be.
OB: After copying the package, the destination folder contains a package named 'ui'.
EB: After copying the package, the destination folder should not contain a package named 'ui'.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, perform the following steps:
1. Open the org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui package in jdt.ui.
2. Select the 'Copy Package' option.
3. Specify the destination folder as xxx.
4. Verify that the destination folder now contains a package named 'ui'.
